lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, tonight we have our fantastic sponsor, Shadow of War!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shadow of War! Oh shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we allowed to say what we did in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a number of us actually worked in the game. It comes out October 10th, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And the full name of the game is Middle Earth: Shadow of War, for all of those who are looking for it alphabetically.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The sequel to Middle Earth: Shadow of

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, and many of us were in the game yelling our asses off. I played a little character known as Orc 4. It was so much! I did 20 recording sessions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I remember talking to you! I was Commanding Orc 1.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was Professional Orc 1, as well as the Witch King of Angmar, the head of the Nazgul. I'm pretty excited about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, nice!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was Troy Baker's fluffer. It's prestigious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were in it, right? No?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm in the first one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, what did you do in the first one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The thing I killed two weeks ago? That was me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Laura, were you in it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am in it. I play the Blade of Galadriel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You play a sword?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! Get this, so I'm an assassin elf, right? She's really cool. The DLC is going to be about my character.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have a number after your character?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's the only one. It's the coolest thing! I don't think I ever told you this. When I saw the character design? She's a combo of Vex and Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she's an assassin. She's got dual-wielding, and she wears feathery armor. It's so freaking cool! So basically, it's like if Vax was a girl, which is Vex.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But with the sex appeal of Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will never forget being at the Shadow of War panel at Comic Con, and you mentioning the DLC and then going, "Has that even been announced yet?" And there was five seconds where I watched Laura wither away into a shell of a human before they went, "Oh, yeah, it's announced." And you reverted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Even at this very moment, as I said it, aftershocks. "Was I supposed to say that?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They scare you so bad that, even when it's official, I'm like "I'm in the--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can testify.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're supposed to mention that on the 18th of this month, Shadow of War will be debuting a brand new live-action trailer that will take you near the game? No! Right

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And make us rise to the higher echelons of the orc order.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the way, if you haven't played the previous game, the Nemesis system is one of the coolest things I've played in many games in a long time. I'm going to challenge you guys to try and pick out not only who you voice orc-wise, but then to try and make sure our orcs rise to the very top. So you have nothing but generals from Critical Role. I challenge you for this. Because that would be pretty cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hope you like hearing the word ranger.

lines.name: LIAM, TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Ranger!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Give what you can. I've given, and we really appreciate that support.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Watt's $30+ million dollars. Irma, the damage is still accruing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I grew up in Florida. I know the area well, and I have family out there that endured it. It's very close to me. So if you can, greatly appreciate it. Let's see here. Merch! Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This feels so weird to say after you mentioned that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, but we make happy stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Happy stuff! Which, by the way, you're wearing your Dalen's Closet shirt, Matt, and it matches your eyeballs so beautifully.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll show it to you, and my back brace, to make it really better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we selling those in the store?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The back brace?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Critical Role back brace! Do you DM 20 hours a week? We've got something for you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Next time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No next time!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're really cool; they're cheaper because they are sleeveless. That's less material. Dagger, Dagger, Dagger; it's been re-released. We have the Scanlan tee; we have all the tees. And it's getting cooler now, so the hoodie is still in the store; the softest hoodie ever is there. Go check it out. We have hats and we have key chains and necklaces and pencils and aprons and tarot cards, and other stuff. And more stuff coming! So keep your eyes peeled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Laura. Also reminding you guys, we have up to episode 40 of Critical Role now released on iTunes, Google, and geekandsundry.com has all the information for it. So if you want to listen to the podcast, or your friends have been like, "I don't want to watch it, but I just want to hear it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to watch it, but I don't want to

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good for commutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, clarification, speaking of saying things prematurely before I should have. I've gotten a lot of questions being like, "What happened to that plan of rolling out one a day once a week?" Yeah, that plan didn't turn out to be feasible. And I might have said that-- I said it, and then I looked down at the announcement sheet and it said in parenthesis afterward, "But do not announce this part." Which, why was it even on our announcement sheet? Still my fault.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To be fair, I remember looking down at the sheet as you were announcing it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit. Anyway, it's never going to happen because they're easier to do in batch. So ten at a time. That's what you get.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like one cookie at a time. You can't bake one cookie at a time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just better to do them in a block.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for the heads-up on that. We announced a while back the Critical Role six-issue mini-series comic book. We announced last week that it's going through Dark Horse, which I'm super excited about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: DM is very excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Dark Horse was my introduction. I was probably in fourth grade when I got into the Alien comics through Dark Horse. I didn't realize there was more to explore. Dude, I've been a fan of them ever since. Being able to take this into their realm is brilliant. I'm so excited. First issue drops on the 20th, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The digital issue. The first issue releases digitally this coming Wednesday.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it good? I haven't read it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so good!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why have you all read it and I haven't?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because you don't read your emails.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's fair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You show up ten minutes after we start, you leave an hour before we end the game every week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's coming up. It will be on Comixology, iBooks, Dark Horse Digital, Kindle, Nook, Google Play, etc. It's written by our good friend, Matt Colville. It's drawn beautifully by our good friend, Olivia Samson from the Critter community, and the coloring and lettering by Chris Northrop. Super stoked, hope you guys enjoy it. So look out for that next week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looks fucking

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What he said.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you already say about the physical copies, too? When those will be released?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have a trade available in spring 2018.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's coming out with the DLC for Middle Earth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be talking about our episode tonight. So look for that next week. All the Critical Role episodes are now available on Alpha. They've gone back and added the bells and whistles, the information, the stats, everything, for all the episodes before Alpha even launched. So if you ever watched it there, it's all updated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I really should check my email!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They get your unbridled reaction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like watching Home Alone next to Macaulay Culkin. It's great. I'm getting so much out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sub-tember means for the next few weeks, Twitch has a special promotion where subscriptions are half off for new subs for every Twitch channel, including this one. So if you've been watching and you've always wanted to subscribe, but you never really felt like you can give the full $5, it's half off this month. So if you want to subscribe to our Twitch, now's the month to do it. Just giving the heads-up. It's pretty rad, and thank you, Sub-tember. Last but not least, Laura and Travis, you are going to be at an event soon, aren't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come out, say hi, smack our hands, not our faces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give a high-five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love Atlanta.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And then, also, in the middle of November, we're going to be going to Australia. Laura and I are going for two weeks. We're going to be in Adelaide, Brisbane. So for all the Aussies-- what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to get my passport.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Expedite!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So barring Laura's passport showing up--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's how much it costs to expedite.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. I'm doing that tomorrow! I'm going to write a note in my calendar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everybody tweet Laura tomorrow at noon, saying--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but seriously! If you want to, feel free.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will Friedle will be there, too. He's going to be my convention wife. Me and Friedle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm writing an email to myself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Australia? Is that when we got caught with having to have those weird travel visas, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Make sure you get your travel visas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we didn't know until we got to the airport. And then they're like, "You have to have one." And then we're like, "Oh, okay." Luckily, you can do it online.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I totally have that covered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we left off. As you guys all crawl through this recently cleared opening, you come into a partially collapsed cavern about 20 or so feet wide in places with elements of the ceiling fallen in. You can see the rocks that are scattered amongst the ground rumbling with each impact of the feet of the titan you're currently riding within. It seems to be going at a steady incline beginning baseline and then about 20 feet ahead, begin to rise upward to about a 30 to 45-degree angle with the next 25, 30 or so feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you play Dungeons and Dragons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two weeks, Sam? It's too much for you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've forgotten entirely what we're supposed to do now. Insight check! I got nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to do my due diligence and scoot a little ahead of everybody and start looking for traps or anything hinky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, he's dead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did anybody see that guy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we did. We saw him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you saw the corpse after it was there, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody asked me about him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, because you did a good job of killing that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That clearly undead cannibal dwarf eating flesh, as I saw it, so problem solved. We're on a time table, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should keep moving upwards, I'm assuming?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we get any items recently?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I picked up that hammer that was hitting me in the face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yeah. But Percy, the belt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, what does it do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stuff, things. I'm using it right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need to do a switchery-poo of our items?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we maybe should do that, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all have potions, right? Did we pass out potions?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We all have at least the one superior from the brass dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going to take a little 20-minute breather here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is just for us to remember what we're doing. I don't know. Should we stop? I think we're on a timetable. We should keep moving, right? Does anyone need to heal?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We just stopped, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd taken a brief rest after the battle with the trolls where you guys began to look about the inside of the vault. And that's where the part of the exit collapsed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't roll any hit dice. Should we roll some hit dice?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You dug things out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he was doing something? He was reading, or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you were trying to read Dwarvish, or something. And it took an hour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I clearly do not remember this. That's right, I remember. I don't remember what I read, but I remember.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It just said, "Do not enter."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. There were things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're doing the Vox Machina thing and standing around like a bunch of dumb fucks trying to figure out what to do. I'm going to attune the Deathwalker's Ward to necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Necrotic it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We also need to be on the lookout for that sword, remember? In the story?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The sword of Kas?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just saying. Keep your eyes peeled, high-perception people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I literally can't see anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, we have light.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whoosh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between her hand, his dagger, and Pike's mace, you have a few light sources that you guys maintain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's mace is lit up. We said that last time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But do keep in mind that light sources also do make you a bright beacon in dark places.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably your hands are less noticeable than Pike's mace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think they would be less intimidated by a glowing mace than by glowing hands, at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glowing hands is like a small torch firelight. The Mace of Disruption--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is like a headlamp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So maybe we'll not have the mace on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Yeah, okay. I'll put this away."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounded just like her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's turning more and more Canadian as you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's kind of Canadian already. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if I could have a marching order, please?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yo. Up front, looking for traps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you want this acid-resistant armor? You'd at least be resistant to acid.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And Vex is probably with her brother. I'll be right behind the twins. It's the twins and then me. Who wants to be behind?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be behind you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Do you have Trinket out, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, Trinket is out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's after Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have that marked down. How far ahead are you tracking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 20 feet ahead, you begin to make your way up the incline, and it is loose rock in this tunnel. As you step, there are elements that skid and fall beneath the pressure of your feet, and you have to be careful as you progress up the incline based on how much it continues upward to keep your footing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Brother.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make sure you stay within 60 feet of me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I turn around and look at her and go: all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said you're 20 fucking feet in front of me, I'm using my fucking earring to whisper to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're stage-whispering and that's very easy to hear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stay within fucking 60 feet of me, all right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love you. Perception check. Investigation for traps? Yeah. That is a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sides of the walls begin to close in and eventually, about 30 feet ahead, comes from the 15, 20-foot width that the initial entrance way into this carved tunnel was, pinches to about three feet wide.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How tall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About five and half, six feet tall?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this pressure by design, or is this what's been done to the structure by the transformation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where you are currently, it looks like part of the tunnel was carved outward and then shaken, and elements of it collapsed and loosened the earth that at one point was packed at the sides.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the tunnel's rising steadily upwards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's coming at an incline.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How's it look?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's dark up there. I can only see about 60 feet up. Does it keep going beyond that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The incline isn't increasing. It gets to about a 45-degree incline and then maintains that up until the outside of your visual range.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm a punching bag for this shit. Why don't you all wait here a minute. Wait.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to fly up there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, will you go with me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course. Can you not use your wings?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, then hop on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This could be the last time we do this. Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, there's only four games left, Sam.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's scripted! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's going to be a Reddit thread later.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have Pass Without a Trace on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think that probably faded by now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not if you haven't recast it because after the short rest it would've been gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I cast that on us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, wait! I shouldn't because I got a proficiency, so we're both stealthy stealth. We're fine. So we're just going to go. I'm not casting it. But here's the thing. Everybody stay right at the bottom. We're going to fly up, but we're not going to fly up more than 60 feet away from them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. We'll go 60 feet up, see what we can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then come back down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. Or you could stay there and I could go even further up 60 feet--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. As long as everybody's within 60 feet of me. Because we're getting really close and I don't want Vecna to see us. I've got this ring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's right. I forgot about the ring.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Let's do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys glide up on the broom, stealthily, I want you guys both to roll a stealth check, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pick from your fucking 300 dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Almost poked my eye out. You almost made me Vecna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That's impressive. So as you both quietly coast your way past this entrance way, squeezing into this two and a half, three-foot-wide location, you get just within the 60 foot range and look up and Vax, you step off the broom and make your way quietly up to the other side of the range. You get about 30 feet beyond the broom before your vision meets where this tunnel seems to end and it looks like there is a solid, rocky blockage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you see?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's corked up. It's all right. Yeah, it's blocked up with stone. I guess I'd have to get a closer look to see if we could get through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, get a fucking closer look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we have to, we can just have Grog beat it down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but quiet is the key word.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it? We can try and time it to a step.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hand on the sides to get my way up closer to it. Looking for any traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an athletics check as you're climbing up to maintain the strength, as the incline is now towards the end getting more and more steep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get ready to catch me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hover.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes! My athletics is a two, but I rolled a 19, so 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deftly, you manage to find the proper handholds and pull your strength up as the final bit becomes a little bit of a upper body weight carrying situation, and you come to the edge of the rock and you see it. It does appear to be a rocky cave-in or larger boulder that has fallen or been placed to close. It looks to be one solid rock, yeah. At this point, the entrance is about four foot by two foot. And it's all blocked by one solid piece of rock.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe Kiki can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we see any other openings?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, my friends just told me to start paying attention to the cadence of the steps to see if they change in any discernible way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what we're doing. While they do that, we're timing the steps out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it is a pretty discernible pattern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could go have Grog smash it down in tempo with the steps so that the sound will be covered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like Shawshank Redemption and the poop pipe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was thinking of the Tainted Love Levi's commercial.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I see any other--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really. It mostly looks like loose rock and the more you glance about with each impacting footfall, you see two or three errant rocks go. You guys watch as more rocks tumble down the incline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hop on the broom, darling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like the idea of you punching this at the appropriate moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It also saves me a 6th-level spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that's what's most important. Are the Knuckles still doing that vibrating hum thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go into a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would like to try and bash the shit out of this--

(boom)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. Okay. It's hard to discern what shifting in the distance is not the rumbling from the ever-occasional titan footfalls, but nothing seems to catch your attention. Occasionally, you hear dislodged rocks and stones clacking across the stone floor and the steps, and every now and then you catch a stone or two fall past and eventually come to rest either near or below you. You continue up the switchback stairs and lead into a third switchback that continues upward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 40 feet in advance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are following behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you looking for traps as you go, brother?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am. That is an 18, anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still have my hands guiding Percy, our blind human.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leading the old man forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (old man voice) Where's Steven?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Where's Steven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not find any other traps. There's no other issues that worry you upon this climb. You do eventually come to the top of the third switchback stairway and it leads you into a slight curved cavern. The stairs stop and it leads into a continuation of the dwarf-like hallway structure that you had below, but it is curving around now, in sections. I would say, as opposed to a gradual curve, the design in the structure here has a very rigid, geometric shape, so the curvature is in sections.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I appreciate it as I go, and I look for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Love it. That's an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Coming around the edge: no traps, no plates. Nothing catches your attention. However, this tunnel comes to an end, and it opens up into a larger crevasse than the one that you previously saw that held a number of city buildings of the remains of Thomara. It looks to be about 100 to 120 feet tall, you assume, from the bits of the stalactites that you can see, barely reaching the edge of your visual range. Very faint bit of light here, bioluminescent fungus in a dull orangish color that dots the edges of this interior chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And is it like where I killed that motherfucker? They were built into the cliff face, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. This one is larger than the one you were in before, and you can see just beyond your visual range, a number of these buildings, partially crumbled in some places, some still standing obstinately against the ever-shifting interior of the titan's form, the chamber curling upward as the ceiling crawls higher and higher just beyond your visual range, and you can faintly see the images of dozens of thin bridges that weave over themselves across different levels, up into the higher portion.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to confirm an intuition and use my last Divine Sense and feel undead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what's the range on that one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 60 feet? You do not sense any undead within the 60-foot range.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we're in the lungs. I think we're in its chest cavity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Speaking into the earrings; they're all behind me. I think we're in a more populous place with the undead cannibals, know what I mean? There's a very large cavern in here and a lot of room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd be grateful if anyone got a sample of that bioluminescent fungus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get that. I'm interested.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to fly up and get some?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're on a schedule here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if it's on the way. We have to go that way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to go up, right? Does it look like there's openings in the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well currently you're the only one who's stepped into this entrance to look up, the rest of you are now exiting into the chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll wait, obviously. Nothing's going to explode on my friends, so they catch up with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so they're all behind you now where this entrance is, and as you look past it, this hallway that you're entering, it looks like there was a doorway here. There was some sort of hinge on the edge that held a door that had since been broken or toppled forward. You can see pieces of the door that once held this entranceway, and a number of the buildings immediately to the right and left. That's where you stand, what do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like there's any footprints coming in and out of the doorway that we came from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look for a doorknob or a keyhole?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything we were told is that this place is full of undead cannibals.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in a long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there shattered remnants of the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you see a couple of shards here and there--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any doorknob or a keyhole that's on the ground or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check. Lot of investigation checks today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You scramble about and find a couple of pieces that might be, but no, it's just more stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see any stairs carved in the side, in the walls, trying to head up to this-- is that what you just checked?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's what I was about to look for, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any movement, because there's bioluminescent shit on the walls in here, so there's a little bit of light, right? Yeah. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. As you glance about-- once again, your vision, because there is very little light in here and the very, very faint bits of fungus in the distance that give you a sense of the shape of this entire chamber. There isn't enough light for you to make out any shape beyond the exterior of your visual range, so you can't really tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A second thing I want to look for is what other exits from this gigantic cavern. Ways through, up. Yeah, you looked, but I didn't look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me finish what I was saying first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll! Roll again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But based on the size of this chamber and the bits of what small elements of structures that you can see of the architecture within, this definitely appears to be more of the heart of the city of Thomara when it was once at its ancient height. You can see at the very edge of your visual range a cracked central fountain that is empty and dry, and you see, just beyond your range, the exterior of a large temple-like building that rises out of the ability to see any more of its height and structure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Temple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But like I said, you guys are still standing at the entrance to this cavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What about the temple? Why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Want to fly through here? Can we fly?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think we want to stay here--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, that's why we just fly through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Find another exit, yeah, but where?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to see the temple, if I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well look, all right, my gloves--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep your voice down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) My gloves come from the heart of a ruined primordial titan. So if maybe they harvested pieces of my gloves, and it's in a temple, I don't know, you smart people could do something with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, what's your plan? You expect us to come up with a plan to explain why your gloves are connected to that temple, and you're going to get what? A Mighty Morphin Power Ranger bonus for doing so?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are your Titanstone Knuckles exalted yet?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. They're just buzzing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, are they still dildoing on your fingers?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they buzzing more?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are they humming more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't appear to have changed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, just humming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Step two steps closer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two steps closer to the temple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they appear to be buzzing more?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are they appearing buzzing more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh! 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not bad. Nope.

lines.text: Is the temple on the way? Does it make sense to cross through the city, or does it make sense to fly up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're moving towards Vasselheim now. I'm negative on our chances of dealing with this before Vasselheim, but that's the goal, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got some time, and I feel like this city is an opportunity to find some more advantages.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's if it's in the temple?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would Vecna keep the thing that could kill Vecna near Vecna?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pulling Percy aside. I hear you, but this is a city that has existed here for a long time. Vecna didn't create this city. Vecna doesn't own these people. This is a fucking mountain that existed and now they're going for a ride. What do these people have to do with Vecna?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not a city that just existed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a giant primordial beast that people inhabited. God only knows what existed in here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but as we've already seen from the other tomb, it's already been heavily, heavily plundered.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These assholes don't have anything to do with--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why did he choose this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away is the temple? Do we know? Can we football range guess it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say, because you guys have darkvision of 60 feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If gods really understood how this world worked, this would not be happening right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's at about the 50, 55 foot areas where the wall begins, then it vanishes beyond that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, this shitbird has appeared like three times wherever we were.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he's not going to be able to do that right now because I've got a fucking ring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He doesn't necessarily know this place as well as--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. How long have we been in here, versus how far have we been from Vasselheim? Because we are on a time crunch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 200 miles away once we entered is how far away we are from Vasselheim. 200 miles. With steps of?

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.text: You've been within the titan for, I'd say, roughly three and a half hours, maybe.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have time to check the temple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's swoop in and swoop out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super fucking fast!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not even saying look in it, let's take a look at what it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I see any stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see any staircases within a 60-foot radius of where you're standing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We might be harder to spot if we stay on the ground for now, anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing is free.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Pass Without a fucking Trace. It's my last Pass Without a Trace, but I'm afraid--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, don't do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we bring out an entire fucking city of undead dwarves upon us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Save yours.

lines.text: I'm also going to put something on the table here: we're trying to save Vasselheim, but we're also trying to save the world. We might not be able to do this without recharging before Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm aware.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to go to sleep in this undead city?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but we're trying to save the world, not just a city.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: What if we lose the fight Scanlan? Then who fucking cares? Vasselheim is gone. Westruun is gone. Kaylie is gone. Everything's fucking gone if we fuck this up!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about this? Hold. Wait! We still don't know how to get up there, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that purple eyeliner?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do you like it? Thank you. It's a little metallic. Thank you, I bought it while I was waiting for--

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I hate to say split the party, but what if we split the party? What if a few of you check out your fucking temple, and then the rest of us try to figure out a way to get up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm cool. I'll vote for a temple party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Temple party. Who else is on temple party?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They need somebody who can help them in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hate the idea, but I'm the stealthiest motherfucker in this room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then you three on the carpet, you on the broom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need the carpet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait, just the two of you are going to go check out the carpet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax is going in with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like one person with magic should go with them. I'll go with them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all ear-pieced.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so Grog--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody but Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's Keyleth, Vex, and Pike are going searching. The boys are going in the temple, and the girls are going searching.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, cool, I'm on board.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is in no way, by the way, an amazing mirror of that one time underneath Kraghammer. They're just going to find another Clarota.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The boys all die. The girls go to glory.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to kiss Percy before he goes. Don't die in this stupid temple.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will not die in this stupid temple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I slap him in the face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right on, Scanlan. Sorry, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's traveling in what group?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Girls are going to look for stairs, the boys are going in the stupid temple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I yank the druid in for a kiss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait, shit. Your fucking ring.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! My fucking ring! We can't split the party.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, can't split the party. We all go looking for the stairs. Oh, you asshole, stop it! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was really excited about it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was waiting on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, he was so excited about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, into the temple. Come on, let's just fucking go to the fucking temple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was like, you guys literally had this conversation an hour ago, but okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever we do, we can't split the party (fast-forward noise). Okay, we're going to split the party.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sam saved our asses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was Cabin in the Woods shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 40 feet in advance, Vax walks ahead of the group, hating himself. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. What are you doing, you're checking for traps?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm checking for enemies hiding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you push forward--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're stealthed, we're Pass Without a Traced.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, then roll some stealth, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She Pass Without a Traced us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, then roll some stealth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're all rolling stealth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's so excited about that temple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20 for Pike! Oh wait, she gets disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She has the boots that make it not at disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First time ever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But that's a lot of good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So much good for one shitty--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to push forward past the cracked fountain, heading ahead of everyone, keeping an eye out for what's ahead of you. The high walls of the temple-like structure begin to reveal themselves, standing ominous over the debris-strewn streets with shattered carts and bone fragments. The bone fragments faintly quaking beneath every footfall of the walking mountain that you currently are walking through. You see long-decomposed dwarvish bodies brutalized beyond reanimation lying scattered across the broken street paths ahead of you, deep grooves marking the splintered bone. A tangled network of partially ruined catwalks begin to reveal themselves above you, carved from the mountain, contains a ghostly image of a multi-level metropolis long fallen. You, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 29. You can see, as soon as you get to where the fountain is, the center of the street ahead of you. Dozens of slow shifting creatures moving throughout the streets and rubble of crumbling structures. You can see now, many of the undead citizens of the catacombs are now wandering, shaken awake by the lumbering titan that now carries them within. You also see a very faint blue pulsing glow emanating from one of the windows of the temple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we put the goliath on the carpet so he doesn't kick something or be himself?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't know that he rolled shittily.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that, but he's a big, blundering mother fucking asshole when he wants to be--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On the chain. Literally on the text chain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, as you're saying this, you hear a (clattering), and you glance over real fast and watch as Grog is walking by and the edge of his-- which weapon do you have attuned right now? You have the Blood Axe? The Blood Axe hits the edge of a large dwarven statue that had fallen off at a corner angle and is currently being held by a small barrel, and as the axe hits it, it shifts (crashing) and rolls and comes to a rest for a second with this clattering, grinding sound. Parts of it chip and break, but most of it remains strong and sturdy upon impact. At which point, you see at the edge of your visual range, about seven of the wandering creatures go (raspy groan) and begin slowly slinking their way in the direction of the noise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So a rock just fell?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A big statue just fell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And is in pieces?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Parts of it are broken. It's still pretty sturdy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's try and serpentine around and see if we can trace back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And they're to the right or the left or ahead of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're ahead of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look like they saw us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go left. Jenga, jenga, jenga. Can we put Grog on the carpet now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to go up, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we're trying to go towards the temple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Towards that pulsing light.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've got a little bit of business, a little bit of activity ahead of us, so we want to curve to the left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, we move accordingly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys move along the left and curve around the side. As you begin to move along the edge, you watch as about eight of these mostly-skeletal dwarvish corpses begin to shamble in the direction of where the noise came from. You can see elements of their long-mummified skin pulled tight against elements of the rib cage and the skull. Bits of chipped teeth, now broken against whatever things it's attempted to chew on its long un-life. As they move past, two of them glance over in the direction of Grog, and then all of them shift over in the direction and begin rushing forward in your path.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the distance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, they're probably about 50 or so feet from where you are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't want to make too much noise. I'm going to shoot a couple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could just go straight up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's only eight of them. We can take eight undead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pickle walks forward and takes a knee and waits with her holy symbol of Sarenrae, waiting for them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take two of them by surprise. That's auto-crit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax does the same, watching his badass sister, and Pike waits to turn whatever's left of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they're super-silent arrows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what happens first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. She's preparing for it, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. She's waiting until she sees them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, well she also has darkvision of 60 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So she's waiting until they're within range of her holy abilities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the radius on that one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good question, because I'm a rogue paladin. (sighs) Goddamn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What if I look in the sorceror rules?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. 30 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 30 feet. So she's waiting for the twins to do their work and anything that's left over she's going to scatter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. So as she holds position--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's auto-crit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's as threat, and they're rushing. But you do have advantage on the hits because they don't see you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well great, that's great. 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That definitely hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a 19 plus 14.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 25, 31, natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. So go ahead and roll damage on those. Are you shooting two different skeletons or one each?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm after my sister. She talked before I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll see how the first arrow hits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 14, 15, 16. Two lightning damage. Do I add anything? Sneak attack!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Been a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we D&D? Plus ten sneak attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the first skeleton, the arrow hits it and the torso explodes behind with ribs shattering and scattering across the stonework, its body falling and collapsing to the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hit another one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, and we go first, so it's advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 14 plus four lightning damage. And that is plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. This one right behind it, its jaw unhinged slightly. Its tongue made of this slick rotting material that dangles through the hole in the bottom of the jaw. Comes around the corner, and you watch as part of its head explodes off one side from the secondary arrow, taking out what remains of the center of its skull, and the body crumples to the ground. Two skeletons down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sneak attack hits the first time we connect, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You don't have to roll damage for that one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Sorry, I did sneak attack on the second arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you can do sneak attack once per round.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I did eight damage too much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was still enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to roll damage for sneak attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So then that one's gone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A third skeleton now is ruined. You hit it with the arrow in the middle of the spinal column, and it folds on itself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So paladin action-action and my bonus action. So that's the first of three. The last one's the one that was a critical hit so the second one goes onto the next whole skeleton. It's just an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. This one the arrow slides into the side of the skull, and it keeps coming forward towards Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. And then the last critical hit, which is Whisper again, because it bamfed back, is two plus eight is ten. Two and three. It's not that much. It's 15 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And that one does finish it. So that's three skeletons down. Grog, I want to to individually roll an initiative check for me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20. With Gil's dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys are watching this happen, the other five rush in to close the gap, but you are at the ready, and you get to strike before they do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reckless, great weapon master. 31 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you slam into it, you watch as its bony body blows up against the side of the nearby stone building and then scrapes to the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use the other strike on another?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reckless great weapon. That'll hit. That's like 30.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If there's anything left on Grog by the end of this, I'll try to swipe them off with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So two more detonate on this point. So there's three left. They're closing in on Grog. Does Pike want to take her turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We might want to save that Turnt Undead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I think we should save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're half of Pike right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to pop in and see if I could take a couple--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an initiative roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't shoot, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not; I'm going to use my sword.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike holds, breathing hard, looking at them coming on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that beats them by one. So yeah, as the three remaining ones start charging in towards Grog--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run in, draw the silvered sword, and take some swipes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take three swipes right out of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike can use her mace on anything left in that area.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I crit on a 19 with the sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, never mind. And a two. But that might be enough, because I have a really high-- that's a 15 as my lowest to hit. Does a 15 hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 does hit. Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So the 15 is-- That's 14 piercing damage to the first one with a silvered sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You rush up and you carve through the first skeleton, and it breaks on the ground in front of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Number two is 13 points of damage to the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The second one, you bring the blade down into the skull and cleave it in half. You watch as part of its skull breaks off to the side and the jaw falls to the ground and the rest crumbles in place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I twirl around and take my third wonderful pirouette attack, which is 20 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and as the final one lunges forward, in a fervent-- strangely faster than you expect for a skeletal undead, it begins to accelerate towards Grog. And with that, you take the blade and take the head right off at the neck, and it falls and crumples to the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's like 28 Days Later zombies?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 28 Days Later, they run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said that they were fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the last one-- it was flavor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just wanted to make sure they weren't special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you finish the fray and hold yourself, you wait and wait. You do not hear or notice any more advancing undead from that direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, how about I don't move and somebody with flying ability go to check out that blue glowy window?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have to stick together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the glowy window within 60 feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it's far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we were at the opening, we were 50 to 60 feet away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The temple where you guys were at, at the time was 50 feet away from you, but you would have crossed the other side of the hall. So now it's about 100 feet away from you. At this distance, you can see it's a round, almost cylindrical building, Colosseum-esque. And there's a small square window about every 25 to 30 feet. And it's big. It's large, but you can see that faint glow between multiple windows from this distance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So should we fly up to that window?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it'd be safer to stay on the ground level and sneak. Because if we're the air, they are going to see us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we still have Pass Without a Trace, so let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we do. She cast it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, now that this brief combat has finished, those who took place in it, which would be you, Vax, Grog, and Percy have to remake your stealth checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're like, "Gladly!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Pike? Because she just knelt down. She didn't really fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She stepped out of her stealth. She was making herself visible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My natural 20 for Pike, wasted!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We still have Pass Without Trace?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. I didn't do anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keeping that concentration.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Concentration.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're the doctor! Keep your patients on the run!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 30 for Pike. 29 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys begin to slowly make your way along the left wall of this large cavern.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 37, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know. As you slowly move through the shadows, dodging through open doorways and through windows, trying the best you can to stay out from the center thoroughfare of this opening, you see more and more of these undead. Dozens, maybe even a hundred have crossed your path at the perimeter of your visual range and you can see in the catwalks above too, with the faint bit of the orange glow, occasionally shapes breaking across the orange. This entire cavern is swarming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Do we still have the thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the filter? The censer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have it in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We also have the herbs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we use it? What if we use it and it just repels them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When it's time. We don't have a lot of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a very small amount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it ready to go, though?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's prepare it, and when it's time--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it ready to go, though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah it's dried. I spent that time. I spent time during the break.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just burning the herbs, though. We don't need the censer. Just hold it in your hands.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we have any sense of where we started in this giant cavern? Or are we totally fucking turned around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you've been moving slowly. Staying stealthily, you're moving very carefully and very slowly and judging by the shape of the cavern and where you are currently, you're about halfway through it, or close to halfway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good that we didn't go on the catwalk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The temple's on the opposite side of the chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh! All the way on the other side. I thought it was central.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sorry. When you entered the entrance, the temple was to the front and to the right of you. You guys curved around the left, on the other side of it, keeping a view on it so you could see it from across the way. Are you making your way across to the temple?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's pressed against the opposite wall of this big place?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are the undead all around the temple?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Further in. Nothing directly around the outside of the temple. So you guys curve around the entrance where you came and slowly make your way towards where the temple emerges from the rock wall. About a third or so of its exterior wall is actually built into the side of this cavern, and the large cylindrical-like Colosseum temple structure curves outward. You can see as you get closer to it, there's maybe the three floors to it but edges of the top wall have crumbled inward and you can see areas where it looks like it's sustained some physical damage or eroded over time. You eventually make your way around the outside wall of the temple to one of the first doorways, and it is an archway, maybe six feet tall and about four feet wide. Very simple. This is an old temple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that light you talked about coming from one specific source, or all over the place? Every window.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a story?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be coming from the base.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From down below.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see in one of the windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can look inside. Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any bone laying around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plenty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am going to pick up two bones, give them to Simon Two, and tell him to go across the street, 50 feet away from us, and wait there in some building. Hold these bones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as two bone shards slowly glide over, then stand there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you pull up to the window and glance down, you immediately look inside the temple, and you see about 30 or so silhouettes of shambling dwarven corpses all standing inside the base floor of this temple. You see the silhouettes and shapes because they are all faintly outlined from the source of this blue light. You see a small, baseball-sized, bluish crystal that is resting, not in the perfect center of the temple but somewhere in the open middle floor area, and it looks like these 30 undead are surrounding it, and standing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smash and grab. You could go in there and get that thing, be out before they even saw you in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, have your unseen servant make a bunch of noise and have them all--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Be a distraction?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but making any kind of noise would draw large crowds.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can have the unseen servant pick it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away can he be, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's 50 feet away, right now, and he's waiting to make noise.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if he were to go in and get it himself?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He is invisible, isn't he?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He could go and pick it up and come right back with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But first don't tell him to come right out, tell him to like walk a little bit to see if they follow the light.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But what are our options if that doesn't work?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he picks up the crystal and it doesn't work, or it doesn't move?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to do that. If that doesn't work, I can click the boots, and I can be there in a heartbeat and run, but what do we do next?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need an escape plan, right? How many can fit on the carpet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This goes back to my conversation with you, which is: are we going to find a pocket and rest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, but not here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Agreed, but we're talking about Vasselheim, and is damage to Vasselheim a sacrifice needed to be ready to do what's necessary?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If he destroys Vasselheim, he does his miracle, his display of power, and he will be even stronger. That is not an option.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we were to be clever, if we're at the edge of Vasselheim, the Vasselheim forces will be distracting his forces, so we'll have less to deal with, so we want this fight to happen at the edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're talking about no rest. I'm not talking about a short rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There will not be a long rest, I don't think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There might be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not without him spilling into Vasselheim.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've been very conservative with what I've been doing for a reason.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think a long rest is in the cards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've only burned one thing that requires a long rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree with Grog. We can't sacrifice having him gain all of those followers, because then the only option would be murder a lot of his followers, which I'm not really comfortable with.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And he may be too strong at that point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't need to discuss this now. We need to get the crystal and get the fuck out of here!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can pull this off without burning anything important, then it doesn't matter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to go on record and say I think this is stupid. Okay, let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That crystal looks really appetizing, and I want it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about we get ready to leave? I'll get on the carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks really super magical.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's on the broom with Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, who is on the broom with you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be on the broom with her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to get on the carpet with me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have to come with you because I have the Pass Without a Trace spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We all have to be together. We can't separate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And he can fly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he can't. He's done with his wings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have too many people for the carpet and the broom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My wings are gone. There's no wings for Vecna unless we rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, kick Trinket out of the necklace, and I'll get in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can also climb up the wall, if need be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can leave Trinket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's fine, I still have the boots. Just the wings. It was death or wings. I chose wings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, so how do we fly? How do we do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can burn a spell and be a giant eagle or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for shits and giggles, I'm going to take one last look around to see if there's any infrastructure for getting up. There must be infrastructure for getting up here. There wasn't layers of a city on top of each other.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But wait, where are we going though if we get this thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Up away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have no verification of an exit or a hole or anything!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sometimes you just got to leap, okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's my entire life, but this is the last moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Every organ in a body has an entrance and an exit, right? Wait, no, lungs don't; they just have the one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait up, we argued more this game more than anything else. Okay, we know we still have to fly upwards, including on flying up to the blue crystally thing right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, the blue crystal is right here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, then what the fuck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have a plan for getting the crystal, just not how to get the fuck out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We fucking fly!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who burns a spell to become an animal?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can burn a spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're probably going to take another short rest, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can recall Simon 2. I can send him across the room, make a bunch of noise, draw a bunch of people over there. You run, grab the crystal, and then we hustle out of there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if only half the room leaves, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you go get Simon 2 to go get the crystal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And there's going to be a floating crystal that marches across?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They don't give a shit. Do it. I'm on the carpet. We're ready to go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're on me? And you're on carpet, and you're on broom?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy and Vex are on the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gnomes on the carpet with Grog. You and Percy on the broom. You're transforming into what creature?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Giant eagle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Giant eagle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not yet, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then we all, within 60 feet of each other, fly up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, who's doing what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Simon 2.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Simon 2 is going to go get the thing. Let's say they all start watching the thing come towards us. Grog, are you here? Are you with us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I have to be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you throw something across the room to make a noise?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. I can absolutely do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll prime an arrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a hooded lantern that has fuel in it. It will even burn when it lands. It's been sitting in there for four years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a terrible plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why we hoarded it in the first place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Simon 2 could create a distraction. He could (snatching noise).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, only with the boots.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If they chase the jewel, fuck the jewel, and we'll leave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they chase the jewel, we can grab it and run, anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Simon 2. Come back with your bones!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bones shift over towards you ever-so-slowly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Don't worry, be happy now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Simon 2, go to the middle of the room. Throw the bones away, far, then grab the crystal. You don't have pockets. Run back to us! Away, yeah. Should he cover it with a blanket or something? Do you have a hood?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bones begin to drift.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm not saying no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A handkerchief to put over the light.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it blocks the light? All right, so go put this handkerchief on the thing, pick it up, and bring it back to us. Go, Simon 2. You're our only hope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Simon holding bones or a blanket?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's holding a blanket.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: He's holding a hanky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put the bones down gently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's a handkerchief. You'll put it over the crystal, pick up the crystal, and bring it back to us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Simon begins to slowly walk, the handkerchief floating by.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is like those little handkerchief ghosts you would make in kindergarten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You notice that all the undead are facing the crystal, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Why didn't you tell us that before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) That's crucial information.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right before he picks it up, hock a rock as far as you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not the lantern?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not the rock, the lantern. Light the lantern and throw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: By the way, they're all staring right at you. They're 100 percent aware of what's going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not staring at you. They're staring at the crystal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They will be staring at us. What if we destroy the crystal? I wonder if all the undead would die. Let's keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Simon walks between the undead, and they don't even notice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a good guy, that Simon 2.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The handkerchief moves over onto the crystal, and all the undead look over to the crystal, and the crystal lifts, and they all begin to (groans).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take the hooded lantern and I (laughs) I throw the fucking piss out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an attack roll. Roll and add your strength modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's good! 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're adding your strength modifier to that? Yeah. You're aiming at the opposite end?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If the entrance is here, I'm throwing it in the opposite direction of where we are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It arcs over (flame noises) and explodes. The oil spreads across the ground. Flames ignite, and the bright light that emanates from it and the flames burst, and all the undead turn over (grunting) and begin to retract away. Two of them are following Simon. Only two of the undead are following Simon, currently. The others are distracted by the detonation of flame. They look confused.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How close are the pursuers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're making their way slowly. No, they're much faster than Simon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm throwing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to get down and shoot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just the ones following Simon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys roll an attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are they far away from the other ones that aren't leaving yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't matter; they're not paying attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we hope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought you were made of sterner stuff, Travis. Come on. Now is not the time to get squeamish.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We made a solemn oath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They were innocent.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We agreed, weeks ago.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 77 for mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The flames are dying down, and... no, no other undead see it. Slowly, the stone floats past, out of the doorway, and makes its way back to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Drop it in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Simon's getting real close to the end of his hour-long casting time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've served us well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bag of Holding. It doesn't hurt my hand, or anything, does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool! We've got that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we have it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing happened to them when we put it in the Bag of Holding? They were like, (groaning) and kept going? All the undead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the undead inside that were distracted by the explosion of the lantern are riled up now, and they're starting to wander around, and some of them are starting to make their way towards the entrance to the temple. Some are making their way toward the staircase to head upward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we flying?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, we fly up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You go into eagle form, grab Vax, and all of you guys make your way up into the cavern entrance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bubble. Tight bubble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, I believe the eagle form has darkvision. Right now, you have no light source.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do. I can say things to her. I can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so you guys are able to maneuver. So as you guys head up into the center part of the cavern, above the catwalks, you can see as you push through, about a third of them are still standing. A lot of them have collapsed in the center, and there's edges of bridges that come to a halt where they've collapsed and tumbled down into the cavern below. You can see straggling undead wandering the catwalks and these pathways along the edges of the cavern. As you pass forward through them-- I imagine you guys are cruising through as fast as you can?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trying to avoid them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll try to avoid the clusters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hundreds and hundreds of roving skeletons and mostly decomposed, mummified dwarven corpses that all glance towards this explosion. Some have been blasted away from it by the impact of the detonation. Others are making their way towards what the strange sound was, drawn towards it, but you're keeping this central safe space between, where none of them can grasp or assail you.

lines.name: LAURA
