lines.text: Were there other buildings like that, ready to fall from the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, what you see is just the one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: MATT; You see entrances to homes that are built into the sides.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about a tunnel or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. Anyone who has darkvision can make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have keen sight. Does that count?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on your perception.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shitty and shittier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't do one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm weeping over Simon 2.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. Your keen eagle vision-- wait, you said you rolled shitty and shittier and still got 28?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a plus 13, plus advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. All right, cool. So glancing through your eagle vision, you can see the top of the chamber almost seems to come to a conical shape, and as you look up to the top of it, it emerges into a completely vertical chamber that rises up and out of the central opening of the city of Thomara.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the lead, I guess. (caws)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shushes) Caw quietly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax is trying to appreciate his last ride.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Debbie Downer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Every game until the end, motherfuckers!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need to take a break, myself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sponsored announcement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. We have the Shadow of War video coming up at this break to give you a glance at this game coming up that we're all part of. If you haven't seen it, or if you have seen it, check it out, anyway. It's pretty awesome. Also, for this week's giveaway, Wyrmwood, we've got a little video for you here to show you what's up and what you can do and try to win it at the break, so pay attention, stick around, and we'll see you guys here in a few minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is what's up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to climb upward through this 15-foot-wide or so upward hallway, this cylindrical cavern, you continue upward for about 50 or so feet since passing through the ceiling of this chamber, and then it opens up into a domed room. Immediately, as you fly up, you see a ceiling come up, and you have to coast off to the side. You catch yourself, hovering there as the rest of you guys make your way in there. This domed, mushroom-shaped chamber with a very thin, circular floor around the outside with the hole that you entered at the bottom. Whoever would stand on the edge there would have the opportunity to either leap into or toss something down into this hole that would then drop them right into the center of the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weird question: if I were holding the blue gem and had dropped it down this hole, what would be the likelihood it would have ended vaguely where it ended up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at all. It was a ways off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just checking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any undead around us right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently? Glancing around, you do not see any undead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said things or people? Is this a body-sized hole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's about 15 feet wide. The full chamber is maybe 50 or so feet across. About a 20-foot walkway, circular, before the hole in the center.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you say the hole is a natural gap in the cave, or does it look made?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you glance down and look about the interior of this chamber, it is not natural. It is all carved.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we look at the gem for a second, since there's no undead around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to. Grog has it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want me to pull it out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Can you do an arcana check on it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I can look at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How big is it? Is it baseball-sized?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about that big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No undead, right? No creatures, nobody that's going to (whoop) to the shiny blue light?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't see anything around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at the moment, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I remove the handkerchief. I look at it. I inspect it like a jeweler inspecting a jewel. 18 arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stronger, then weaker. It has this rhythmic flash to it, like a heart or something that has a pulse to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How is it lining up towards the steps of the giant?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at all. It's much quicker.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Much quicker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's cold to the touch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it do anything to the Titanstone Knuckles?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it faster than my heartbeat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's slower.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's slow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's very slow, but not as slow as the rate he's walking.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a cut jewel, or is it rough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's rough. No jeweler's hand has touched it. There are some edges that have flat surfaces; it looks like there have been things that have chipped off the stone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it have the vibe of something petrified?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Elements of it appear to be cloudier or imperfect, and some areas appear to be clearer, and light shines through a little brighter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like a hunk at the natural history museum of minerals.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, but there is an enchantment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about Pikey-pants? Can she detect if it's evil or good or something? Does she do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You don't get a sense of any evil from the stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said no sense of evil?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No evil coming from the stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to gaze into it super hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look really hard into the stone as you hold it to your face, and your eyes almost cross as you glance into the very core source of this pulsating arcane energy. It's bright.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So bright, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hurts a little bit, and you wince after a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw so many things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She looked at the eclipse, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't have Identify or anything like that, do we?

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know who had that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, who?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our good friend, Tary. He was wonderful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who is it? Oh, the fancy fellow? He's probably dead somewhere.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we should try and smash it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you think that about everyone and everything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not against this idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else are we going to do to it before we face El Vecna?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My only other thought of how it could be useful, at this point, with what we know about it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is "El Vecna" Spanish for Vecna?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sí.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seemed like the undead were crowding towards it, which means that if we do get attacked by a group of undead, we might be able to shiny-object them, unless, of course, it's dangerous in their hands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or we spike it down the hole, and it causes a hydrogen bomb, and we shatter this titan in half.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That literally made the dungeon master laugh, so I don't know if that's necessarily--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's blue, right? That is the color of hydrogen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the color of Dr. Manhattan. I don't necessarily know if it's the same thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is known.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we hang onto it for now? In a moment of peril, we can throw it or smash it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not crazy, trying to crack it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What if it stops this thing where it stands? We're all thinking that this thing could be its heart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Its heart?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's palm-sized, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could be a chunk of heart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the same color as his Knuckles?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, these are stone-gray. This is blue crystal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's nothing about it that gives you the sense, based on what you've seen both outside and within the titan, that it is of similar essence to the titan, from what you understand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It could be a soul or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Soul glow?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does Pike have anything that detects a soul?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not evil. It's not good. It could be the thing that's keeping these undead moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, then I don't know what else to do. I think we keep moving.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like the spiking idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm okay squishing it with the hammer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that you should let me squish it, because if that blows up--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's funny that we spent so much time getting it, and then we're going to destroy it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We spent ten minutes getting this thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll think about smashing it when we take our rest. Maybe a cause will reveal itself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold onto it for now. It could come in handy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like that dress you bought four years ago you still haven't worn. It might find a purpose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, focus!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's get out of this dome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any writing or engraving or runes on the edge of the circle that's been engineered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the edge of the circle? No. It's smooth stone, intently designed to be a drop or opening of some kind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are there exits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check. You don't see any doorways or passageways.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, there's not a hole that we can go up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a hole that you came through to come into this chamber. Imagine a dome. You're in the chamber.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I literally rolled a one. I'm aware that there's a hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get vertigo as you stand in the chamber.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this investigation or perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation to see if there's any hidden or not-immediately-noticeable exits or entryways.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. As you do a pass around, looking closely along the wall, you see two small domed doors that have metal rods jammed through, almost like a small barricade that's been placed down on one side of a doorway. However, they are closed from this side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you could open them up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they trapped? I'll look to see if they're trapped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also fair to assume that whatever's on the other side of that door--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're both looking at the same one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Neither of you notice any traps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, then I'm going to try to jimmy open that lock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I already said it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not locked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two! Wait. Yeah, that's straight-up strength, not a saving throw? Two!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm really fucking weak. You'd think I'd be stronger pulling the bowstring, but no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Use your legs. Really, use your legs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I put my legs up on the wall and (grunts).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is not budging.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I use my finger skills to see if it's locked? Just my finger skills. I made a perception check to see if it's trapped. Wouldn't I know if it's locked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no handle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to sidestep this lock with my lock-picking skills.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: It's a barricade.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's nothing to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like steel rebar in front of the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any decorating or writing or scratching around the door frame or wall around the door? Anything other than a portal to go through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from what you can see, no. The room's pretty simple. The construction of it may be older than most of the things that you've seen in the city below and previous chambers. It seems to be built almost for function rather than ceremony.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a trash chute.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was going to say. Is it a water chute? Drainage? Is this a drain pipe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could fill the city with water. Drown all the zombies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One thing you do notice, which is interesting as you're glancing around at the side, looking at the ground at the bottom of it, there's a very faint groove in the ground that leads toward the central hole at the base of each of these doorways.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does there appear to be any other type of chutes coming into this room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just the two doors on the opposite sides.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far apart are the doors?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Opposite sides of the chamber, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's a bar. The door is barred, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So break it. Let's get out of the way and pop the bar. See if we can pop the bar right off the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to have Keyleth there in case 900 undead zombies start pouring through, and she can Wall of Stone the door?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be with you. Yeah. I'm right behind you, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will try and remove one of the doors. I don't know how to delineate between them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The left one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Yeah. It's a circle. That one. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. It immediately comes off to the side, and when you lift it, you realize that it's bolted to the wall to the side, and it curves upward and holds it in place. This is meant to stay in place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Really? It was meant to move? I think I loosened it for you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't get that sense at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you lift it up, the door is now unbarred.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall I?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, open the door!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are the hinges on this side so it looks like it opens towards me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it opens towards you, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll pull open the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm at the ready for whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. We'll say as you entered and landed, the door on the left. Okay, so as you pull that one open, immediately preparing yourself, a couple of rocks tumble out, and it reveals a packed-tight mass of earth and stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! Let's try the other one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I punch the rubble?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, let's try the other door first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I make my way around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We set ourselves up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 20 on the dot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. (metal creaking) It lifts over without an issue. Pull the door open. You lift it open, and a few rocks tumble past, but a slick rockslide incline continues upward, dry, no water. Nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A rockslide continues onward. Slick, dry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How big is the tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about four feet wide or so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can fit in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can fit in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have some Immovable Rods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When I say slide, I mean smooth stone, like an actual slide. You get the sense that there was some sort of aqueduct-type scenario.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We brace ourselves on the wall to make sure we don't slide down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoever's in the back should have the Immovable Rods, so if there's a sudden rush of water, we can create a grate for ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You envision that at one point, long ago, this would have been a beautiful waterfall in the center of Thomara's chamber that has now dried.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dope. That's awesome. I'm getting creepy as fuck now. I've got the Immovable Rod; I'll be the caboose.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got the other one, so I'll be second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog is the caboose.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth in front of Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth in front of Grog? All right. Who's in front of them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then Pike. All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Myself and the twins, I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I want to be in the front.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go ahead and take the Immovable Rod out and have it in my hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Samesies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way up the slide, and it's relatively gradual; it's not too heavy of a scenario. You make your way upward, upward, and about 30 or so feet up, the walls of it separate out and appear to break into two smaller chambers, like this was a breaking point where a person could enter from either side to check on the flow or do maintenance on whatever the ducting was. The slide continues upward. Vax and Vex, you get to that portion and lift yourselves up, looking right to left. It ends on one side, and it looks like there's some dry-rotted wooden crates, and to the left, a staircase.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it looks like a landing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a brief landing for somebody who needed to come in and do repairs, maintenance, or checking on the flow of water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep going up the slide or take the stairs?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Quick glance in the crates?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, if you're going to take a quick glance, then we have to bust them open like a proper RPG.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're dry-rotted. They'll break easy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They will. What do you do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Check them out. I eat some edamame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you lift the crates. There are only two of them, and they're relatively small: two feet by two feet. The first one, you open up and look inside, and there are rusted tools. Long iron bars; some appear wrench-like. It looks like whatever mechanism was used as the early aqueduct system for this, this box contained materials, though you're uncertain as to what their application was into this system.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a glance at these things to memorize their general shape.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After you're done with them, I'll actually take them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very basic; nothing too intricate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is some basic shit that you're picking up right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was the first crate. What's the next crate? Is it whoopee cushions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the next crate you open up and it looks mostly empty, but it looks like there are a couple of rows of small glass vials, half of which appear to be broken or shattered, but there are three remaining, with a faint bluish liquid on the inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that sound familiar to us at all?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Healing potions are blue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These don't resemble healing potions, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do these resemble underwater breathing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do. You've seen these before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For toilet diving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Emergency, yeah. Let's take those.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I got them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I keep one. No, I don't. I'm barely alive. I give one to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I give it to Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got one. I've got two, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, then I'll keep one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just in case.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got two vials of underwater breathing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why is there no water running?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any other boxes to smash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd imagine because he's vertical now instead of horizontal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And undead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's keep going up the stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Heading up the stairs in the same order?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 30 to 40 feet in advance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way up the staircase. Roll stealth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Immovable Rod's out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 28 for stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Are you stealthing, as well? Are you going along with him, or are you letting him go ahead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also see a figure stepping from a side wall crevasse, an opening of a similar shape to the circular opening in the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We were stealthed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were stealthed. You re-hide, while stealthed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear some muttering across the way in the shadow. There's a faint source of light that looks like a glowing orb that's floating in the air above and giving this faint greenish-white light; a bauble that's giving a light source to whatever this cloaked figure is. You hear the muttering, and two more walk down the staircase to join them. You recognize, from the faint bit of light, a glimmer of metal around the neck of one of them that is the symbol, the hole with the metallic fork. You see Remnants of Vecna.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remnants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see any faces. You see a glimmer or shine on the metal from the light cast from the bauble.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This can't be happening right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't recognize faces? We don't see faces?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are three of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, so they're cultists.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So which ones are you aiming at? There's three of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm aiming at the first one I saw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the first one you saw just stepped out of the center of the hall there, and then the two others walked down the hallway. You're aiming at the one that came out of the side of the wall?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Has he seen the two coming down the stairway yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They seem to be aware of each other's presence, but they haven't come together to engage as three in the same area yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will follow my sister's lead. If she attacks one, I send one to another one and two to the third.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll attack the first so he can take the second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One. Two, three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These are auto-crits, though, because we are surprising them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I Hunter's Mark him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so we don't have to roll for attack? It's an auto-crit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, you still have to roll to see if you aim. You have advantage on the attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 27 on my first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, both hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Second attack. Oh my god, 20. 20 on the second attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got a one on both. Thank god they were both at advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all three hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And they're all critical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the first one crits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, really? Okay. The first is sneak attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not all crit. Once you hit the person they are no longer surprised.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so the first one is a crit. Solid! That's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel so bad for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are the most powerful person at this table.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 14, plus six lightning damage. Oh wait, you know what? Should I single out the lightning damage or say what all the damage is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's an auto-crit, so lightning damage is doubled, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's 12 lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, plus whatever your sneak attack damage is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's happening.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You already did 40 point of damage without doubling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Travis, shut up! These two and their gigantic damage rolls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Huge, mammoth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huge, bulbous.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Turgid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I had already rolled that, but it was a six again, so 40, plus 12 lightning damage. On the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 52 points of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got 48 on my first, but that's it. 48, done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't do Hunter's Mark damage on that first guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is on the other guy; the second guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten because of Hunter's Mark on the first one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little bit of that reach around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The dice smell a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 48 on your critical.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled really low.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, ten. Okay, then. All righty. Are you shooting the same guy, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I notice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he did not go down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, then the second one. 21 on the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That does it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much damage? Total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pointing your direction like (gasping). As soon as the two other daggers go into the other two, they both see the one crumple to the ground, the two left there, the guy who is standing at the stairs--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I also dump some poison?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, into which one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Into the first one. I did one into my first target and two into the second; the poison would have gone into the second person. It's a DC of 15.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So nothing, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Balls!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one in the center of the chamber glances over his shoulder and says, "It seems I'm the lucky one. Odell, run back and tell that Viskorad found "sneaky prey." The one immediately to the left begins to run up the stairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I shoot him again before he runs away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope because you took your turn. This is their reaction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit. You need help, Matt?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Initiative!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're about to roll initiative, motherfuckers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, guys. We did it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Viskon? We've heard the name Viskon before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've also heard the name Odell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, Odell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, when did we hear Odell before?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just know we've heard it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's been three Jamieson's in our campaign, too. Matt isn't an infinite fount of names.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone else is still down the stairs right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if we should have let them talk for a second. Oh, well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not our way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So now, I need everyone to roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's okay. I've got advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't let them leave. I agree with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Leave one of them alive, but don't let them leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not good for Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did everyone roll shittily?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get that long range. Get that runner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's up, bro?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not fast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's weird for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's almost as low as I can go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 for Pike? No, that's Vax. What's Pike?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike clocked in at four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is clocking in as Pike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Where's the remix of this song?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. (beatboxes)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so beginning of the round. Vex, you're up first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to cast Grasping Vine around here, so he can lash up and try to catch that wizard, the cloaked guy that's running away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's he have to roll for that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has to roll a dexterity save above 15.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get it! Get it, son!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's an eight. He is running up the stairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it snatches his ankle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then drags him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Backwards. Then I'm going to shoot him twice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not that one. That one looks like he knows too much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that? 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32, that hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 14, plus four lightning damage. I don't get sneak attack on this guy, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. 14, plus four lightning damage, and then I'm going to hit him again. That is also a 32. No, that's-- well, it's very high. 27? 28

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. All right, that hits. Roll damage. Grog, you're up next. You're in the back of the marching order.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're not up at the top, are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. So you've got at least 25, 30 feet before you can get to the top there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12, plus six lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. All right, 36 points of damage in one round. The arrows (impact) as he is pulled through the rock and rubble by the Grasping Vine that is currently wrapped around him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am going to use my movement to stand behind this little pillar right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As I hear the sweet melodical Miami Vice tunes of warfare being played, can I double dash up past my mates and into the fray?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, so at 30 feet, it'll get you right at the edge of the stairs. Still have 20 more feet you can go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, straight towards them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that's there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then can I use dash to go the rest of the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To close the gap there? Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now, I only have my bonus action left, so can I go into a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may, yeah. All righty, so at that point you go into a rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so now it is his turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have that guy? But this guy was the runner, I thought.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but he's vined.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. He's currently grasped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as soon as you rush up into his face, you hear the individual, the hood pulled back at this point. You see shaved entirely bald, older, late fifties to early sixties, missing one eye, but in that socket you can see a faint spark of arcane energy. Shouting out amongst the space, "Glory and reward is mine! Wraiths, go forth and devour, while I bring oblivion to them." As you rush up, is going to cast Wall of Force right in the space between there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Between him and Grog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) The space between.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Your wicked lies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It pushes you back five feet, and now there is a Wall of Force that is blocking that side of the hallway from where he is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Him and the other guy? Or just between him? How big is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, the entirety of this chamber is the Wall of Force.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking fuckface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does Wall of Force do? Can I walk through that shit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it just might hurt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like there's nothing there. He's grinning from there. He glances over to the right into the hole in the wall where his friend was earlier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which was that way, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he glances over, he goes, "Odell, bring me the sphere." You hear the humming noise, the faint humming vibrational noise, now louder. That ends his turn. Actually, he is going to take a step back up onto the stairs there. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm up? What can I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're 20 feet down from the staircase.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My speed is 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll get you right up to about there, with five-foot steps.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't let them leave!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, this looks like a crazy thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (counting) 60 is how far away he is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. There's a Wall of Force. Do I see a Wall of Force?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't. You actually rush up, and it looks like it's an open hallway right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I see Grog in attack mode, right? I see these two bad guys. I will send a Lightning Bolt at somebody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Looks like I can't see this guy because there is a pillar in between, so the other guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crackling noise) It arcs forward, and as it gets right above Grog, it hits something solid and splinters. No effect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So this Wall of Force visually is floor to ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know; you don't see it. He saw a faint shimmer because something pushed him out of this space, but right now you have no visual perspective. That's going to end Scanlan's turn, I believe. All right. The other guy, who is currently held by the vine that falls limp off of his body--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It falls limp off of his body?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, that humming gets louder and louder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He had the map. If he built the map, there's a way out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as a two-foot-wide black sphere of void-like nothingness comes carving through the stone wall immediately to the left of you, Grog, leaving a completely disintegrated form roughly the shape of its sphere. It's coasting in towards and into your space.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a Sphere of Annihilation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh shit, son!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is someone controlling it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog, I need you to go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, roll so well! Do you get advantage?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do. I have Danger Sense. It fucks you up. Yeah, it hurts real bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I see this happening, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. You manage to duck out of the way as it enters the space, and you can feel this weird energy. Your beard is almost being pulled toward it, and the loud vibrating (vibration) hum before you. It's like staring into an absolute nothingness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take my life, but not my beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who looks like he's controlling it? Odell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guy who is being pulled by her is concentrating and moving it over, at that point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the guy in red? The guy in red is controlling it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (yells)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've got to rest for a second. Controlling enemies hurt. It's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can get dudes behind you to hold you up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see how I can do it. Keyleth, your turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. So much has changed from what I thought I was going to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're about 25 feet down the staircase.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. So I come up from the staircase.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That gets you up to the edge there, where the staircase stops.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does the Sphere of Annihilation get an attack of opportunity if I run away?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a thing? Is it a weapon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a black sphere of void. One of the guys is looking focused, concentrating on it, and it moved under his willpower in the direction of Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's real bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm going to stick with my original instinct and do Wall of Stone and try and wall these guys in so they can't run. I think they can still carve through it with their big black death orb now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They can, but at least they'll be here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They'll have to move the orb to do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I can do ten ten-foot by ten-foot panels, so I want to be a semicircle block off, bring up a whole wall of stone behind them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Hold on a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who can get to the other side? You have Dimension Door. But that's it, right? That's the only person that has that kind of a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you attempt to concentrate and create a Wall of Stone, you are unable to pick a point or an area beyond the barrier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Wall of Force? No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say it again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you need to focus, or is it a random?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't fizzle the spell. You have no area to release it on. The barrier, while invisible, is preventing targeting a specific area to create.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to dispel this shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do have Dispel Magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've used your action to attempt it. You didn't lose the spell slot, but you spent your action attempting it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, man. That was a nice try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can't cast through it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good to know. But the orb went through it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the orb is on the other side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even though it's a nature thing, going up underneath there, I can't get around it? No?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're targeting on the other side of the wall. It has to be in visual range for you to create it to happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of Keyleth's turn, you hear this (breathy noise) sound as these two shadowy figures emerge from the nearby walls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ghosts! Shadows!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. What? Ghosts or wraiths?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wraiths.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's ten different kinds of things like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, was wraiths what fucked me and you up when we were evil Vax and Keyleth?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh shit, and look what they're doing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one hovers over and lands behind Keyleth. And it's going to attempt, as it seems to shift through the pillar--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look over my shoulder and go: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one here stays within the pillar, and it reaches out, as it's incorporeal, and strikes at you. That is 24 against you, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You suffer 21 points of necrotic damage, and I need you to succeed on a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck! Come on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My fucking god!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a 20? (screaming)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Well, you suffer the 21 points of necrotic damage, and your maximum hit points are reduced by 21.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Forever?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Until you finish a long rest. The other one's striking at you, Keyleth. That is a 16.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Misses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, because your AC is 17 with the ring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right! I leveled up, motherfuckers!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Cool. Technically, leveling up didn't affect your AC; however, calculating the magic item did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I feated, so I'm good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. So as it swings toward you, its claw streaks out and has no effect. And then they both vanish. You want to take an attack of opportunity? You can if you'd like to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: War Caster?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: War Caster. You can attempt to cast a spell on it as a reaction, if you'd like. This one's going to back away into the wall, as well. Vex, you also get an attack of opportunity if you'd like, with a melee weapon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it have to be a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it can be an action. That's part of the War Caster feat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a dagger, but I don't even have it drawn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then yeah, you're fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're both out of visual range, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both are now backing up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One's in a pillar, and one went through a wall. Are they moaning and shit, in the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't hear them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't hear them. Can't see them, can't hear them. All right. Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No worries.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have resistance to necrotic damage, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do! Then you take ten points of necrotic damage, and your hit points are only reduced by ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, I'm trying to figure out what would be a good idea right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no ideas for anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have never done this before, but I have it learned. I will Ice Knife it in its face. Ice Knife! Level one, you create a shard of ice, fling it at-- oh, it's a flingy-thingy. But it's 1d10 piercing damage, and then it explodes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's right next to you. She has the feat where she can cast the spell as a reaction when something comes at her. Just know that whatever you're hitting is right next to you. So if it explodes, does any radial damage, it might come back and hit you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm doing it anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And Scanlan's in five feet of her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's behind her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for fuck sake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's wrong with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wasted all of our 20s on goods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tonight is ridiculous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you release the Ice Knife, it slams into the wall. No effect. However, it does still explode, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it does what damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d6 damage. So go ahead and roll 2d6. To both you and the creature?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, all creatures within range.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Technically, reroll ones. Three, four, five, six, seven. Yeah, each creature. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you take seven points of ice damage, and it hits the wraith. However, the cold damage doesn't seem to have as much of an effect as you would expect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a fucking wraith!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends their turn. Percival, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hear a whole bunch of commotion, so I'm going to pop my head up out of the hole and see what the fuck is going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You glance up and get just beyond where Keyleth is, pushing past. You have five more feet you can move if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I'm coming up the hole. I take a look. Oh, sweet god. I'm going to take a shot at the guy I see up on the table there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which guy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, the gray. And that's 28?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (gunshot) You fire a shot and watch as it detonates against some sort of invisible wall that you didn't see was there before, scattering helplessly against the space in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate this force field shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It explodes near my head, and I'm like: Stop shooting into this thing!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to drop back down the hall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you get right back down to right there. That ends your turn, Percy? Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to dance through to here, where I can see Grog and these guys, and I can see all my friends here, and I'm going to hold my action to attack anyone who comes right up to one of my friends within striking range.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know. Perfect. Ending Vax's turn, Pike's up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike comes running up the steps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that is everybody but Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's my fault.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That gives everybody advantage on wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and any time you're healed, you regain the maximum number of hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Even if we move out of the radius?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It affects everybody at that moment, and then you carry it with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wisdom and death saving throws.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got glitter-bombed with holy goodness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wisdom and death plus what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And full hit points when you get healed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't roll; you get the max.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So ending Pike's turn brings us to the top. Vex, your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, great. Well, I've seen all the things explode. Fucking hell. I'm going to pull out my Vecna symbol, that necklace that we still had, and put it around my neck, because that fucking sphere is out and I don't know if it matters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you quickly throw it around your neck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I still have control of the vine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And it's on the other side of the force?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'm going to use it and I'm going to try to grab a hold of the guy-- the guy in gray is holding the force wall, right? But it probably is a concentration. The guy in red is holding the sphere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guy in red is holding the sphere. I'm going to try to knock him down and see if I can break his hold on the sphere, maybe? Is that stupid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It wraps around him and pulls him tight against the area where it is again, but it's barely shifted him, so he gets moved a few inches, but doesn't seem to affect him at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a bonus action. I still get an action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, and movement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh jeez. I don't know. I can't hit anybody! I'm going to wait. I'm going to hold my action until I see something getting through that fucking force wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Until there's something to hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that I can attack him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sounds good. All right, Vex, that's the end of your turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to try and run through the Wall of Force. It's only five feet of my movement, and we'll see what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you slam face-first into a stone wall. Immediately, the anger fills through you, the familiar smell and taste of iron-like blood as you seem to have busted some element of your nose in the impact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably some eyelids? Do I go anywhere? Not even an inch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if I channel all the rage from my life, and I draw on the undead? Okay, cool. I'm going to turn around and run the other way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You didn't get through?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (counting) 50, right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That ends your turn, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that ends my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy turns around and begins to make his way up the stairs and move double dash, and disappears up the stairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (screams in frustration)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can't do anything. Nobody knows Disintegrate or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whose turn is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes that guy's turn. It is now Scanlan's turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take a few steps forward. I will inspire Grog, I guess.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll sing to him. (singing) Don't mess with that big black ball, it can really fuck you up. I really hate that big black ball, all it better do is miss you, make it miss you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god, that was not my intent in creating this encounter. Take your d12 inspiration die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I guess I'll Dimension Door, try to go through the Wall of Force. We've tried this before, Matt. Who knows how this shit works?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the previous ruling was it worked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but that could have been a gentle nod.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wording is important on this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think the cultist shits his pants and his brain explodes. I think that's in the book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Teleportation, however, you're the target and Dimension Door and Teleport is unaffected by that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt fucking hates this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get the runner!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know where the runner went.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He went that way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't see him, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You saw him run away, you just don't know where he is at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I gauge roughly how far he went down that hall? Do I see down the hall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from where you were over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I'm going next to the red guy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, if you get out of range of Vex, Vecna knows all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah. Stay within 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's my everything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've got to take out these guys' eyeballs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the end of your turn. At which point, Odell, who's standing there currently, is physically sweating, concentrating on this sphere right now. Looks over and sees you appear and goes, "Viskorad, the little one made it through!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are you calling little?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, you glance over your shoulder and you can see that the darting, cloaked one stops and spins and faces towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not good for me, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not good for you, but it's good for us. Fuck them up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as far as they can get. However, it completely disintegrates the central pillar. It is obliterated, like it lays with a top part and a bottom part, but wherever the sphere passes through, about a good six inches around it is turned to dust and is gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, what if we fail these rolls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's then going to go back around--

lines.name: TALIESIN, LIAM
lines.text: No, he's grappled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it doesn't grapple. It just moves things toward it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're confusing Entanglement with Grasping Vine. Two totally different things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's backing up, and he's looking over at the sphere, concentrating on it. You can see the beads of sweat pouring down his face, and he's glancing over nervously at you, but smiling at the idea that his friend is returning. That's going to end his turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Seeing Grog slam into that. Ugh, fuck. This is a pretty beefy spell, yeah? Force Wall? Should I do fifth or sixth level to dispel this? Okay. Fifth or sixth level? Sixth level. I'm going to Dispel Magic this wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you focus and concentrate, you release the essence of the Dispel Magic, the burst of arcane energy casts forth, and falls harmlessly against the exterior.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: It's a higher level.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Higher than sixth level? The spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Didn't appear to have an effect on the wall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, maybe it needed to be something else.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. He did what Scanlan does with Counterspell. He beefed it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's higher than seventh level? Did you have to roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No effect on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything's okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So about that long rest...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know now, you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're fucked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes your turn, Keyleth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) I want you to be alive.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) I want you to be alive.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no, here they come.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They take minor damage being in the physical wall, but that's fine with them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boom, I attack! Sneak attack on the one near Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was I holding for? I was holding until I could attack something, or until I could get through the wall? I think it was through the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, 27 on that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So that is three, plus three is six, so ten. (counting)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can hit them, they're probably squishy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You took out one of three between just two of your surprise attacks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 34 for the first hit, and I have the second paladin attack, so if it's not dead, I will attack again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is eight for the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it emerges from the wall, its blackened shadow form giving off small tendrils of dark black ether and abyssal energy, it reaches out to strike at Keyleth, and you immediately release two daggers in its direction. Both hit its form. It gives this pained sucking sound as you watch its beady, burning red eyes seem to blink in the pain, and it angrily lashes out at Keyleth, its form somewhat more disparate and unable to maintain a corporeal form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When is Pike? Is it her turn? No? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she cast Beacon of Hope. So attacking against Pike. That is 21. What's her AC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that's arcing towards you, Keyleth, that is fucking 16 again! Yeah, because it's plus six to hit. Okay. You dodge out of the way a second time. It's then going to move back into the wall over here. He's going to move back into the wall, as well. Both of you get reactions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike definitely takes it. With her Mace of Disruption, she gets an extra 2d6 radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so roll an attack on that one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a 21 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am wickedly out of my element. I'm running from an 8-ball.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got to get everyone away from that thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 27 for Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 points of damage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a fiend or an undead? So it has to have a wisdom save of 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it has 25 hit points or fewer after taking the damage, which it does not. That one has not taken a whole bunch of damage. However, it did take a relatively decent hit, and you watch as she swings the mace out. As it pulls back, where the mace impacts, it seems to almost evaporate part of the shadowed form, and it shrieks as it disappears into the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For clarification, that is the one I hit, as well, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the one that you hit is where she was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, Pike hit the other one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Keyleth, are you doing anything as a reaction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to pull out my staff and do a Burning Hands on him. Dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20, so it takes half damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Half damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good. You did the six and the four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then there was a third one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then there's a third one that is a six? Was that right? Six and six is 12, so 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 points of fire damage reduced by half which is eight, and even that impact seems to be lessened by the wraith-like being seemingly absorbing some of the heat from the impact.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Radiant damage is the bomb!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Radiant damage is what we need in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, that ends their turn. Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stay in my little cubby hole. I've got some good visual on a couple of these guys down here. I'm going to yell at everybody to get the fuck away from the ball. I'm going to hold my attack until something happens that's going to give me something to shoot at.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fucking hell. I'm going to do the same thing except I'm going to move to here and wait for something to attack one of my friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's awfully close to the ball.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I'm doing. That's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Pike's turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stupid, I know. That's what Vax does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can only do this as a bonus action so that she can have that up, right? Okay, she's going to cast Spiritual Weapon. Should she do it at a second level? Okay, she's going to cast Spiritual Weapon up near the wall as a giant sword that looks like it's on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whereabouts? On the wall here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, near the wall, yeah. Up close to the wall so that she can attack as soon as that thing is down. And then she's going to hold her physical action until there's something that she can attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, she's holding her physical attack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, her mace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that ends Pikes turn. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's you, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm Vex. I'm going to dart away from this ball as fast as I can, and I'm going to come up here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, you broke through!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm too fucking-- It's fine; I got it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Make Matt stand up, Laura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please do. I appreciate it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm going to hold my fucking attack until something comes out that I can attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't believe I couldn't fucking dispel that wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I am, aren't I? Okay. Cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I have bonus action still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to use that Grasping Vine that I still have up, and I'm going to re-grab onto that stupid guy's fucking neck and yank him towards the wall he's right in front of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 15. What's your DC on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It took 425 hours, but we did it. We broke his brain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Blame it on the painkillers. The vine whooshes out and tries to wrap around him. He dodges out of the way, and it slaps harmlessly against the stone and withdraws back into the small crack of stone where it's based. That ends your turn. All right, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (counting) 30. Right up against the wall. Can I look to the left down that hallway? Can I see down there at all? Is it blocking the hallway off from vision? Is that a moveable space?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking off, it looks like the orb was being used to carve a path.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It hadn't finished doing it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It was maybe 25 or so feet down and was hitting solid rock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My spell DC may be higher. I don't know if I have increased that in a while.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's eight, plus proficiency bonus, plus her spell bonus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So my spell DC is 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need to keep up on that, girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was how I lost to Grog in our battle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanted it around his neck, just to make him annoyed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits him against the wall. He's still glancing over his shoulder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's lost visual range of the ball?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he can still look over the rubble there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not enough to make a concentration check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If that's what it does.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm there. I can't get into that hole anymore, can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with the way the Wall of Force is placed, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough. I will hold my action until someone comes within melee distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, ending Grog's turn. At the top of the staircase--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! He's coming back for Scanlan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy here, we'll say he got about that far from the stairs and continues that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sanctuary!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like he's parting the Red Sea.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: You shall not pass!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, we're going against Gandalf right now, you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not Gandalf. That's a cosplayer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know many hobbits I have under my cloak?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five hobbits in a cloak. That's all it is. It's not a wizard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He glances down at the staircase where you are, and as he begins to smile, the flash in the eye begins to glow briefly, a pale comparison to Vecna, but there is an essence of energy lent to him from his worship of the newly risen deity. He begins to speak in a language you don't understand. And as he speaks one alien word-- how many hit points do you have?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A lot. 167.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fuck, okay. I miscalculated. No effect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Power Word?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Power Word: Stun. He assumed the smaller stature of the gnome was not as hearty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's upset that he miscalculated. The DM wants blood!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what he gets for profiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold on. I need to look up the range of a fucking spell. How far is he from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell at this point. You'd say somewhere between 50, 60, 70 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I bet your spell is 120 feet, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm looking. That one's not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it Thaumaturgy? Because that's right where your eyes are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said how far? Oh shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between 50 and 70 feet from you.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: You can move.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to move 25 feet towards him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so that puts you up here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And with my darkvision, do I get a sense for how far he is from me now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you'd say he's about 40 feet from you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck no, it's not. Shit, I need 30.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can move five more feet. You've got more movement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. That's my movement. I have tiny little nubs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tiny little nubs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about long-range shit, man?

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we going to try this crazy shit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might as well. Okay, hang on, though! What are we going to get from this guy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Find out how close we are to Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, what's the plan? What are they trying to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What has Vecna got cooking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's Vecna planning? How many of them are there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go pee, you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He might not know everything. How long does it take for Keyleth to pee?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but how close we are to Vasselheim? What's the plan of attack in Vasselheim? How big is his army? We get five questions, I think, with Speak with Dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How close are we? What's his plan? Where is he?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is Vecna within the city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's with him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's the death knight?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He might not know that. But what are they excavating for? What are they looking for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I know that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I know, too, but I want to hear him say it. It'd make me feel better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it! Cast your Zone, yo!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get in the zone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Autozone!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckling) Autozone of Truth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit. So can anyone drag him down on his roll to save, or boost me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. Not me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So which one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, first Zone of Truth, then Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you create the Zone of Truth, you create the area, the radial space where the divine energy kicks in and the compulsion to not lie remains within. And then Pike--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Casts Speak with Dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On which corpse? There are three corpses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Red robe seemed more fancy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who seemed more senior?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Red robe did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are three, technically.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was the guy they killed right when they burst on the scene.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll take the fanciest cloak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's relative, but the guy who was controlling the sphere seemed to be at least different.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He had a different color. Yeah, red robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as Pike takes the time to focus and recite the incantation, she grabs her holy symbol and focuses and speaks aloud the words in Celestial of the blessing of Sarenrae. And as she completes the ritual, she suddenly screams out in pain and grabs at her head and falls to her knees. No effect. And she suffers--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! What did he do to Pike?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's 31 points of psychic damage to Pike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She tried to cast Speak with Dead Dumbfuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's shaking and grabbing her face and rubbing her eyes, and it takes her a moment to come back to you and she looks around, and you can see a faint bit of blood slightly dripping out of the corner of her eyes. She's like, "All I heard was laughter."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Laughter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you said it was minus 36 damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vecna is in these motherfuckers' brains.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone looks upset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike got psychic damage from that dude.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much? A lot?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 31 points of psychic damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's a lot, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Burn the bodies. Fuck it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Throw them down the well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Throw them into the sphere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sphere! Do your worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll end tonight's game, because it's 11:30.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like I always come back from the bathroom right as we're ending games.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First of all, it's so great to be back!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's so nice to be back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, thank god you're totally 100 percent healed and all better again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's great. Sorry. But yeah, missed you guys. We'll be back next week, pick up from here, see as the final charge gets closer and closer. What will you guys do next time? In the meantime, rest well, don't forget, if you can, to give to the Red Cross to help support the victims of recent hurricane battering in the US.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look for Shadow of War.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shadow of War coming out on October 10th.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our comic on Wednesday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [music]
